comments.body: Listing ten or twenty PolicyRules and a handful of subject/URL combinations that should match and not match each of them will probably take less code than this test and the generator code above, and will have the significant advantage of giving me confidence that the test will pass if and only if the code under test is correct :smile:
The generator is used in other tests as well.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +62,66 @@			r := rng.Float32()
			n := rng.Float32()
			policyRule, matchingRDigests, matchingNDigests, skippingRDigests, skippingNDigests := genPolicyRuleWithSubjects(t, rng, fmt.Sprintf("t%d", i), rng.Float32() < 0.2, r < 0.10, n < 0.10, r < 0.05, n < 0.05)
			t.Logf("policyRule=%s, mrd=%#+v, mnd=%#+v, srd=%#+v, snd=%#+v", fcfmt.Fmt(policyRule), matchingRDigests, matchingNDigests, skippingRDigests, skippingNDigests)
			for _, digest := range append(matchingRDigests, matchingNDigests...) {
